    • displaySuccess

      public void displaySuccess​(java.lang.String callerName, java.lang.Object result, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> additionalInfo)
      Print a message to the console indicating a success
      Specified by:
      displaySuccess in interface IView
      Parameters:
      callerName - human-readable name (usually in the format ClassName.MethodName) where the message is logged from
      result - a single string representing the result of the operation that is being logged
      additionalInfo - a map containing any additional information that may help to explain the result, the keys should be variable names and the values should be their values. For convenience, the values are allowed to be any Objects that get converted to Strings

      Specified by:

      result - a single string representing the result of the operation that is being logged
      additionalInfo - a map containing any additional information that may help to explain the result, the keys should be variable names and the values should be their values. For convenience, the values are allowed to be any Objects that get converted to Strings
